name: Kepler-241
scenarioDescription:
The Kepler-241 Exoplanetary System

Kepler-241 is a star with 0.57 times the mass of the Sun, and 0.67 times its radius. It is located 1989.09 light years away from the solar system.

Kepler-241 is known to have 2 exoplanets in orbit around it.

Kepler-241 b

Kepler-241 b was discovered by the Kepler observatory using the transit method. Its discovery was announced in 2014-03. Its semi-major axis is 0.09 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 12.72 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, Kepler-241.

The mass of Kepler-241 b is 7.34 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Kepler-241 b is 2.33 that of Earth. At 7.34 Earth masses, Kepler-241 b is a so called Super Earth. Super Earths could be terrestrial worlds like Earth, but they could also be ocean worlds or terrestrial worlds wrapped in a substantial atmosphere, in which case some refer to them as Mini Neptunes. No Super Earths are known to exist in our solar system, but if it exists, the so-called Planet Nine could very well be a super Earth, as it is hypothesized to have a mass between five and ten Earth masses.

Kepler-241 c

Kepler-241 c was discovered by the Kepler observatory using the transit method. Its discovery was announced in 2014-03. Its semi-major axis is 0.19 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 36.07 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, Kepler-241.

The mass of Kepler-241 c is 9.24 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Kepler-241 c is 2.57 that of Earth. At 9.24 Earth masses, Kepler-241 c is a so called Super Earth. Super Earths could be terrestrial worlds like Earth, but they could also be ocean worlds or terrestrial worlds wrapped in a substantial atmosphere, in which case some refer to them as Mini Neptunes. No Super Earths are known to exist in our solar system, but if it exists, the so-called Planet Nine could very well be a super Earth, as it is hypothesized to have a mass between five and ten Earth masses.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system Kepler-241, which contains 2 planets and was discovered by Kepler.
